name: Budesonide
indications: budesonide extended-release tablets indicated induction remission patients active , mild moderate ulcerative colitis .
contraindications: recommended induction remission adult patients active , mild moderate ulcerative colitis one 9 mg tablet taken daily morning without food 8 weeks . ( 2.1 )
warningsAndPrecautions: budesonide extended-release tablets available containing 9 mg budesonide , usp . 9 mg tablets white , film-coated , round , unscored tablets be9 imprinted black ink one side tablet blank side . available follows : ndc 0378-4500-93bottles 30 tablets store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) . [ usp controlled room temperature . ] keep container tightly closed . protect light moisture . dispense tight , light-resistant container defined usp using child-resistant closure .
adverseReactions: budesonide extended-release tablets contraindicated patients hypersensitivity budesonide ingredients budesonide extended-release tablets . anaphylactic occurred budesonide formulations [ ( 6.2 ) ] .
indications_original: Budesonide extended-release tablets are indicated for the induction of remission in patients with active, mild to moderate ulcerative colitis.
contraindications_original: The recommended dosage for the induction of remission in adult patients with active, mild to moderate ulcerative colitis is one 9 mg tablet to be taken once daily in the morning with or without food for up to 8 weeks. ( 2.1 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Budesonide Extended-Release Tablets are available containing 9 mg of budesonide, USP.
                  The 9 mg tablets are white, film-coated, round, unscored tablets with M over BE9 imprinted in black ink on one side of the tablet and blank on the other side. They are available as follows:
                  NDC 0378-4500-93bottles of 30 tablets
                  
                     Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F). [See USP Controlled Room Temperature.]
                  
                  
                     Keep container tightly closed. Protect from light and moisture.
                  
                  Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container as defined in the USP using a child-resistant closure.
adverseReactions_original:
Budesonide extended-release tablets are contraindicated in patients with hypersensitivity to budesonide or any of the ingredients of budesonide extended-release tablets. Anaphylactic reactions have occurred with other budesonide formulations [see 
                        Adverse Reactions (6.2)].
